nodes.bodyText:
should we do * instead? or is this only for a one-off?

  
    
  
    

  
  This file contains bidirectional Unicode text that may be interpreted or compiled differently than what appears below. To review, open the file in an editor that reveals hidden Unicode characters. Learn more about bidirectional Unicode characters


  


    
      
        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                regexp: ((pxf-releng-gp5-drop-path))/pxf-gp5-(.*)-2.el6.x86_64.rpm
          
          
            
                regexp: ((pxf-releng-gp5-drop-path))/pxf-gp5-(.*)-*.el6.x86_64.rpm
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -272,7 +272,7 @@ resources:
     bucket: ((pxf-releng-gp5-drop-bucket))
     region_name: ((aws-region))
     secret_access_key: ((bucket-secret-access-key))
-    regexp: ((pxf-releng-gp5-drop-path))/pxf-gp5-(.*)-1.el6.x86_64.rpm
+    regexp: ((pxf-releng-gp5-drop-path))/pxf-gp5-(.*)-2.el6.x86_64.rpm

nodes.bodyText: want to specifically ensure we are shipping and naming as -2
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -272,7 +272,7 @@ resources:
     bucket: ((pxf-releng-gp5-drop-bucket))
     region_name: ((aws-region))
     secret_access_key: ((bucket-secret-access-key))
-    regexp: ((pxf-releng-gp5-drop-path))/pxf-gp5-(.*)-1.el6.x86_64.rpm
+    regexp: ((pxf-releng-gp5-drop-path))/pxf-gp5-(.*)-2.el6.x86_64.rpm

nodes.bodyText: I am curious about the name change -- did you add the underscores to make it easier to interact with this job via the CLI? Or just preference/consistency?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -1532,7 +1550,7 @@ jobs:
     <<: *slack_alert
 {% endif %}
 
-- name: Publish PXF-GP5 and PXF-GP6 Artifacts to GP-RelEng
+- name: Publish_PXF-GP5_and_PXF-GP6_Artifacts_to_GP-RelEng

nodes.bodyText: having spaces in the job name breaks an HTML link in the email, will see if this will be better
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -1532,7 +1550,7 @@ jobs:
     <<: *slack_alert
 {% endif %}
 
-- name: Publish PXF-GP5 and PXF-GP6 Artifacts to GP-RelEng
+- name: Publish_PXF-GP5_and_PXF-GP6_Artifacts_to_GP-RelEng

nodes.bodyText: One suggesting for a future refactor: We could move this into a Concourse var (e.g., pxf-rpm-release) and then only have to work about changing it in one place. I'll add a chore to the icebox.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -272,7 +272,7 @@ resources:
     bucket: ((pxf-releng-gp5-drop-bucket))
     region_name: ((aws-region))
     secret_access_key: ((bucket-secret-access-key))
-    regexp: ((pxf-releng-gp5-drop-path))/pxf-gp5-(.*)-1.el6.x86_64.rpm
+    regexp: ((pxf-releng-gp5-drop-path))/pxf-gp5-(.*)-2.el6.x86_64.rpm

@@ -272,7 +272,7 @@ resources:
     bucket: ((pxf-releng-gp5-drop-bucket))
     region_name: ((aws-region))
     secret_access_key: ((bucket-secret-access-key))
-    regexp: ((pxf-releng-gp5-drop-path))/pxf-gp5-(.*)-1.el6.x86_64.rpm
+    regexp: ((pxf-releng-gp5-drop-path))/pxf-gp5-(.*)-2.el6.x86_64.rpm

nodes.bodyText: Since this is a template and we have looping constructs, would it make sense to define this inside a template loop?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -387,6 +387,24 @@ resources:
     password: ((pxf-cloudbuild-service-account-key))
 {% set gp_ver = None %}
 
+- name: rpmrebuild-centos6-image

nodes.bodyText: could be, I was on the fence there, was actually advising against excessive loop usage to improve readability. I think we mostly use loops on gp_ver, to a lesser extend on centos versions
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -387,6 +387,24 @@ resources:
     password: ((pxf-cloudbuild-service-account-key))
 {% set gp_ver = None %}
 
+- name: rpmrebuild-centos6-image
